results.title: Dilemma
results.creator_credit: Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films, Computer Creations USA and John Halas
results.brief_description: A fully digitised computer-animated film which shows the progress of civilisation throughout the ages, but poses the question whether man will use his inventive abilities for destruction or as the key to progressive creation.

results.title: Dihedral kaleidoscopes (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Art Landy, University of Minnesota and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Geometry”.
Presents basic ideas of symmetry by exhibiting dihedral groups by reflections of intersecting mirrors. From reflection in a single mirror the film proceeds to study the surprising effects and beautiful patterns that can be produced with two or three mirrors. Observations on the general case are made as well as on the limiting case in which two mirrors are parallel.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Art Landy, University of Minnesota and International Film Bureau

results.title: Digital Storytelling workshop : general public (March 2007)
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Sue Silk, Sonya Waters, Sally McCutcheon, Martin Zerfas, Lyn McLeavy, Louise Blake, Llywellyn Staiff, Joyce Evans, Edwin Whiting, Christine Lamb, Alfred Zerfas and ACMI
results.brief_description: Eleven stories from members of the general public. Mostly autobiographical, they are stories that concern themselves mostly with the passions of the creator, whether social issues, history, hobbies or family. These passions and interests are what makes the participants who they are.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Sue Silk, Sonya Waters, Sally McCutcheon, Martin Zerfas, Lyn McLeavy, Louise Blake, Llywellyn Staiff, Joyce Evans, Edwin Whiting, Christine Lamb, Alfred Zerfas and ACMI
